boardgame.name: Drunter _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Drüber
Sans dessus dessous
Wacky Wacky West
boardgame.description: A long time ago, in a village far, far away, some disturbed townsfolk decided to destroy their entire town in order to rid themselves of an evil menace (it's technically a dog-mouse, but I think it's an idiomatic thing). Anyway, so the villagers rebuilt all the buildings in the town (including their precious outhouses), but forgot to include city walls, a river, or roads. To rectify this, players lay tiles with one of these three things onto the board, and any building caught underneath them is automatically eliminated, except for outhouses. When an outhouse would be destroyed, players take a vote on whether to place that particular section. Each player is trying to retain the most of one type of building, and once all the pieces have been placed the winner is the person with the highest valued buildings still standing._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Wacky, Wacky West re-make description:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Fans of Klaus Teuber will be interested in this remake/redesign of Drunter und Dr_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;uuml;ber, a 1991 Spiel des Jahres winner._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Just south of nowhere, there's the junction of the Mayfair _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Rossdorf RR and the Turvy Trunk Line. Springing up from the desert like a tumbleweed lies the eccentric little town of Rossdorf. Like most western towns, Rossdorf has a Land Agent: Guy Dough, the brother of that wicked varmint Black Benny. A shrewd opportunist, Guy's done sold all the town land ('ceptin' the outhouses) four times over! Every acre in town that ain't got an outhouse on it is owned by the miners, the railroads, AND the fort captain. Just about a year ago, miners digging in the shadow of Fort Rossdorf struck the mother lode! But it wasn't gold, and it wasn't silver. No, my friend, it was just a little spring. Not any ordinary spring, though! It was a torrent of that mind-marbling drink the locals call _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Wacky Water!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Now that water's done what the sun and the wind couldn't do: it's made those landholders brave enough to take matters into their own hands. Now they'll use whatever means they can to bowl over the competition and lay claim to the only fertile spots left in town! Now the only thing stoppin' 'em is the Town Charter Amendment #5, which states: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;no landholder may move, remove, or detonate any outhouse without a majority vote of the Town Citizens..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; Now one thing's for sure: something's gonna stink in Rossdorf, purty darn soon....._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Wacky Wacky West you and your fellow townfolk place track tiles, street tiles, and river tiles hoping to destroy your rivals' buildings. Every time someone tries to build over a precious outhouse, the town votes! You try to enlist your supporters (represented by cards) to vote with you to stop or encourage the play of certain tiles-perhaps saving some of your buildings or taking out those of your dastardly opponents._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 1991 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Family/Adult Game 3rd Place
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: BGTG 115 - Spiel des Jahres, Then _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Now
Durchgespielt – Spiel des Jahres 1991: Drunter und Drüber

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Played two or three times. Prefer Paypal but will also accept cashiers check or money order.

Early euro from Klaus Teuber, featuring tile placement with a dash of voting. Crazy Vohwinkel art and a preoccupation with the role of toilets in successful town planning. Fun bluffing aspect with very little luck elements. * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Great condition, little or no wear. Please contact me for postage rates - I am in the UK, but ship worldwide.
original german HiG edition (2nd, 1994) new and shrink-wrapped in perfect condition please ask for the 1st. ed

No, my friend, it was just a little spring. Not any ordinary spring, though! It was a torrent of that mind-marbling drink the locals call _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Wacky Water!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Now that water_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s done what the sun and the wind couldn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t do: it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s made those landholders brave enough to take matters into their own hands. Now they_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll use whatever means they can to bowl over the competition and lay claim to the only fertile spots left in town! Now the only thing stoppin_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;em is the Town Charter Amendment #5, which states: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;no landholder may move, remove, or detonate any outhouse without a majority vote of the Town Citizens..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Now one thing_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s for sure: something_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s gonna stink in Rossdorf, purty darn soon..... In Wacky Wacky West you and your fellow townfolk place track tiles, street tiles, and river tiles hoping to destroy your rivals_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; buildings. Every time someone tries to build over a precious outhouse, the town votes! You try to enlist your supporters (represented by cards) to vote with you to stop or encourage the play of certain tiles-perhaps saving some of your buildings or taking out those of your dastardly opponents.
